sanskrit_verse:
प्राजापत्यमदत्त्वाऽश्वमग्न्याधेयस्य दक्षिणाम् ।
अनाहिताग्निर्भवति ब्राह्मणो विभवे सति ॥ ११.३८॥
transliteration:
prājāpatyam adattvā 'śvam agnyādheya sya dakṣiṇām |
anāhitāgnir bhavati brāhmaṇo vibhavae sati || 11.38||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a Brāhmaṇa possessing wealth does not give a horse and the prescribed fee for kindling the sacred fire, he becomes devoid of the sacred fire.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority rests in alignment with Vedic obligations
Causation arises through omission of prescribed action
Restoration logic demands reinstatement of ritual integrity
Consciousness alignment depends upon adherence to dharma-sankalpa
executable_legal_axioms: IF Brāhmaṇa possesses wealth AND has omitted gifting horse AND has omitted offering dakṣiṇā THEN declare anāhitāgni status
WHEN anāhitāgni status declared THEN initiate Agni-pratishṭhāpana completion protocol
IF Vibhava (material capacity) present THEN Dharmic giving obligation activated automatically
WHILE Dakṣiṇā or Aśva remains undelivered DO trigger sequential dharmic lapse counter
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this principle establishes that omission of mandatory ritual gifting by a materially capable Brāhmaṇa constitutes actionable dharmic default requiring immediate restoration procedures rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa confirms causal link between omission and spiritual disqualification; anupūrvaśaḥ demonstrates sequential loss of consecrated state; proportional responsibility aligns with unmet capacity; non-punitive reality rule mandates reinstatement without inflicting suffering.
final_declaration: Declared under the sole Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma. Justice executed for restoration, not retribution. Consciousness affirmed as ultimate adjudicator. Dharma restored.
